intro: Crotalaria hatschbachii, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its yellow, spurred flowers and compound leaves. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Crotalaria hatschbachii is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
